attributes.action: The letters of comfort given to the murdering IRA should be revoked.
attributes.background: British soldiers who served on Northern Ireland are no being hounded by the Historical Incidents Unit. All these incidents were investigated at the time. There is now a growing consensus among the veterans that these letters should be revoked.

rejection.details:
We're not sure what action you'd like the UK Government and Parliament to take. 

In 2014, an independent review of the so-called "on-the-run" scheme (or comfort letters) made it very clear that the letters given to
“on the runs” did not constitute an amnesty or immunity from prosecution. 

You can read more here: 

https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/CBP-8352

You might like to sign and share this petition instead: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/243947
